column4: what is the best way to keep two folders in ubuntu synchronized ( same copy of files and keep them updated) ?
can someone explain how i can use rsync ?
can someone tell me how i can set rsync to automatically back up a folder whenever changes are made ?
you don't run it whenever something changes.  Your best bet is to make a cron entry
check the link that ubottu posted about cron
easiest way:  rsync -av /sourcedir /destdir
cron is your best bet and you WILL want to learn it at some point
you can simply share a directory on your unix box with Samba and then just view it over the share
you can also use a program on Windows perhaps like UltraEdit that can open the file up over FTP so when you save it, it saves it right back to the server
rsync will work fine
but either cron or a startup script is your best bet
once the sync is up and going, probably not, but it will do that ALL of the time, even when you're in the process of editing it
